recipeTool

Class Storage

  • java.lang.Object
    • recipeTool.Storage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    final class Storage
extends Object
implements Serializable
    This class contains all the ingredients. It stores the following information:
    -name
    -amount
    -unit
    -allergens
    -expiration date.

    The getter methods only return immutable objects and copies of mutable objects, so no changes can be made without proper validation.

    Author:
    Ville Salmela

    • Field Detail

      • map

        private final Map<String,Object[]> map
        This map holds all the ingredients.
        Key: String ingredient name
        Value: Object array [unit, allergens, expiration, amount]

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Storage

        Storage()
        Constructs a new Storage, with no ingredients.

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        void clear()
        This method will delete all ingredients in storage.

      • deleteIngredient

        void deleteIngredient(String name)
        This method will remove one ingredient from storage.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the ingredient to be removed. Cannot be null or empty.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if the ingredient with attribute name does not exist in storage.
        IllegalArgumentException - if name is null/empty

      • getAllergens

        TreeSet<String> getAllergens(String name)
        This method will get the allergens of specified ingredient.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the ingredient. Cannot be null or empty
        Returns:
        Alphabetically sorted list of allergens, or null if there are none.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if the ingredient with attribute name does not exist in storage.
        IllegalArgumentException - if name is null/empty

      • getAmount

        double getAmount(String name)
        This method will get the amount of specified ingredient.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the ingredient. Cannot be null or empty
        Returns:
        The amount, never null.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if the ingredient with attribute name does not exist in storage.
        IllegalArgumentException - if name is null/empty

      • getExpiration

        Date getExpiration(String name)
        This method will get the expiration date of specified ingredient.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the ingredient. Cannot be null or empty
        Returns:
        The expiration date
        or null if there is no date.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if the ingredient with attribute name does not exist in storage.
        IllegalArgumentException - if name is null/empty

      • getUnit

        Unit getUnit(String name)
        This method will get the unit of specified ingredient.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the ingredient. Cannot be null or empty
        Returns:
        Unit enumerable, never null. See Unit
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if the ingredient with attribute name does not exist in storage.
        IllegalArgumentException - if name is null/empty

      • hasIngredient

        boolean hasIngredient(String name)
        This method will check, if the specified ingredient is in the storage. Even ingredients with zero amount are counted.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the ingredient.
        Returns:
        true if the ingredient is in the storage.
        false if the ingredient is NOT in the storage.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if name is null/empty

      • listAllergens

        TreeSet<String> listAllergens()
        This method will list all allergens from all ingredients in storage.
        Returns:
        A list containing all allergens from all ingredients, sorted alphabetically. Never null.

      • listIngredients

        TreeSet<String> listIngredients()
        This method will list all ingredients in storage, by name.
        Returns:
        A list containing all ingredients in storage, sorted alphabetically. Never null.

      • reduce

        void reduce(String iname,
            double amount)
        This method will reduce the amount of one ingredient.
        Parameters:
        iname - Ingredient name.
        amount - The amount to be reduced.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if the ingredient iname does not exist in storage.
        IllegalArgumentException - if iname is null/empty
        RejectedExecutionException - if reducing would lead to negative amount.

      • setIngredient

        void setIngredient(String name,
                   double amount,
                   Unit unit,
                   TreeSet<String> allergen,
                   Date expiration)
            throws InvalidDataException
        This method will insert one ingredient into the storage with the specified attributes. If the ingredient already exist, new values will replace existing values.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the ingredient. Cannot be null or empty.
        amount - The amount of the ingredient in storage. Cannot be negative.
        unit - The unit of the ingredient. Cannot be null. See Unit
        allergen - The allergens of the ingredient, or null if there are none. The values will be sorted alphabetically.
        expiration - The expiration date of the ingredient, or null if there is none.
        Throws:
        InvalidDataException - if any argument is not accepted.
